oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Clover rot (Sclerotinia trifoliorum) and Fusarium fungi in organic red clover in Finland
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yli-Mattila, Tapani
Kalko, Galina
Hannukkala, Asko
Paavanen-Huhtala, Sari
Hakala, Kaija
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We investigated the composition og fungal isolates in red clover roots and the susceptibility of red clover cultivars to Sclerotinia trifoliorum, which causes the important disease clover rot. In leaf experiments, the cultivars Jokioinen and Ilte were more susceptible to one of the S. trifoliorum isolates than Betty and Bjursele, while all of them were equally susceptible to two other S. trifoliorum isolates.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Yli-Mattila, Tapani; Kalko, Galina; Hannukkala, Asko; Paavanen-Huhtala, Sari and Hakala, Kaija (2008) Clover rot (Sclerotinia trifoliorum) and Fusarium fungi in organic red clover in Finland. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 4 (3), p. 21.
